results.title: Join in the Bicentenary
results.creator_credit: Lily Steiner and Healthsharing Women. Publishing and Production Group
results.brief_description: A practical classroom activities aimed at giving children a sense of involvement in Australia’s bicentenial year. Covers a wide range of age levels.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Lily Steiner and Healthsharing Women. Publishing and Production Group

results.title: One drink away
results.creator_credit: Geoff Owen-Taylor, HSV7, Victoria. Ministry of Education and Jeff Spencer
results.brief_description: Looks closely at alcoholism within the community and the devastating effects it can have on the home and industry. The organizations set up to help alcoholics and their families are also discussed. Hosted by Dan Webb.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Geoff Owen-Taylor, HSV7, Victoria. Ministry of Education and Jeff Spencer
results.description: Looks closely at alcoholism within the community and the devastating effects it can have on the home and industry. The organizations set up to help alcoholics and their families are also discussed. Hosted by Dan Webb.
description_for_label: Looks closely at alcoholism within the community and the devastating effects it can have on the home and industry. The organizations set up to help alcoholics and their families are also discussed. Hosted by Dan Webb.

results.title: Return to Botany Bay
results.creator_credit: David Ferris, Victoria. Schools Division. Curriculum Branch and Jeff Spencer
results.brief_description: Intersperses 1987 documentary footage of the re-enactment of the voyage of the First Fleet with Trevor Lunn interviewing an Australia Post representative discussing their role in the Bi-centennial re-enactment and production of the commemorative stamp series.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Ferris, Victoria. Schools Division. Curriculum Branch and Jeff Spencer

results.title: Two sides of the river
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Ministry of Education and Brian Carson
results.brief_description: The port of Echuca was once Australia’s largest inland port along the Murray River. This program looks briefly at life on the river in the early days and at the tourist attraction that the river and its boats have become.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Victoria. Ministry of Education and Brian Carson

results.title: Bendigo pottery
results.creator_credit: Trevor Lunn, Victoria. Ministry of Education and Brendan Kenworthy
results.brief_description: This program gives some insight into the process involved in making pottery and shows some of the types of clay used, the preparation, pot throwing and glazing at the Bendigo pottery.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Trevor Lunn, Victoria. Ministry of Education and Brendan Kenworthy

results.title: Home entertainment last century
results.creator_credit: Tony Paice, Victoria. Ministry of Education and Jeff Spencer
results.brief_description: An Education Officer from the Museum of Victoria demonstrates the type of home entertainment that preceded radio and television in Australia.

results.title: Is the Accord only a car?
results.creator_credit: Box Hill College of Technical and Further Education
results.brief_description: Representatives from the Trades Hall Council (Melbourne, Vic.) discuss the role of unions and employer groups. The main focus is on young people who are just entering the workforce.

results.title: Collingwood
results.brief_description: A historical look at Collingwood which shows and discusses early settlement, farming, brewing, some manufacturing and retail activities. Includes two interviews - one with a former factory worker and one with a shoe factory worker.

results.title: Village on the Yarra
results.creator_credit: Rob McCubbin, Victoria. Ministry of Education and Peter Bence
results.brief_description: State Historian, Dr. Bernard Barrett talks about early Melbourne, the first landing parties in the Melbourne areas and the events leading up to its establishment on the banks of the Yarra.
